spirit_fudo.spriitBehavior: A courageous warrior packed with energy
spirit_fudo.spiritDescription: I am the Immutable One. The wisdom of many years grants me patience. With my rope I bind the wicked.

spirit_fukusuke.spriitBehavior: Protects its summoner and collects nearby Gems
spirit_fukusuke.spiritDescription: I am a princely agent of good fortune. Prosperity thrives in my presence. The ringing of the merchant's bell pleases me.

spirit_grindylow.spiritDescription: I am deeply misunderstund, for my old kinsman have stained my name. Call upon me and I shall prove myself a worthy companion to witches.

spirit_houndAnnwn.spiritDescription: No longer in service of my old Lord Annwn, I am ready to lead your hunt. Let the night not hold us back, for we have the blessing of Matilda!

spirit_indio.spriitBehavior: A warrior that is quick to avoid incoming attacks
spirit_indio.spiritDescription: I am an ancestral guardian of brave adventurers. If you bore me, witch, I will find another.

spirit_itzamna.spriitBehavior: A powerful and high energy warrior
spirit_itzamna.spiritDescription: Lord of Night and Day, I am the first healer and patron to the scribes. I have little time for upstart witches.

spirit_itzpapalotl.spriitBehavior: Binds opponents and attacks them afterward
spirit_itzpapalotl.spiritDescription: I am the Obsidian Butterfly, made of the bones of Mictlan and ruler of the realm of Tamoanchan.

spirit_jikininki.spriitBehavior: Wicked. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven
spirit_jikininki.spiritDescription: I will smile when I am fat with the flesh and blood of all the dead.

spirit_jurupari.spriitBehavior: Defends itself when threatened, and collects useful Botanicals when safe
spirit_jurupari.spiritDescription: I am the Jurupari and you may find my words are as winding as the paths I hide beyond. You may never see my crooked smile, but you will feel it in your slumber.

spirit_kalku.spriitBehavior: A stubborn warrior that targets wounded enemies
spirit_kalku.spiritDescription: I am the dark shaman and the master of strife. If I am not enough to frighten you I can always introduce you to my servants Anchimayen and Chonchon.

spirit_kirin.spriitBehavior: A powerful warrior that targets enemy spirits
spirit_kirin.spiritDescription: You may only ever see me with the purest of heart. I will never appear to the wicked as I value life and purity above all else. If you find yourself consumed by my holy fire, yours is a truly dark heart.

spirit_kitsune.spiritDescription: I am the fox that punishes wicked holy men, the dishonest, and arrogance. Though, I may enjoy a friendly prank now and then.

spirit_lalechusa.spriitBehavior: Capable of casting Shadow Mark; effective summoner protector
spirit_lalechusa.spiritDescription: Don't believe in me? Whistle three times at the bell of midnight and you may find out.

spirit_lamia.spriitBehavior: Wicked. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven
spirit_lamia.spiritDescription: Mothers beware, summon me and I may eat your children and steal your husbands.

spirit_lares.spriitBehavior: Dispels harmful conditions and Blesses allies
spirit_lares.spiritDescription: Call me to your hearth and I will gentle your heart, bless your crops, and protect your sacred places.

spirit_lobisomem.spriitBehavior: Wicked. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven
spirit_lobisomem.spiritDescription: I am the shapeshifter.  The savage wolf is hidden within my human form, until I loose the Beast.

spirit_lubana.spiritDescription: Don't let my appearance fool you, as I tell no lies. I will cleanse a wayward man and bring order by  dominating any situation.

spirit_manticore.spiritDescription: Am I a lion? Am I human? Am I a scorpion? Or am I simply wise? Call on me, decide for yourself and I will protect you and your lesser spirits.

spirit_mapinguari.spriitBehavior: Fires a warning shot of Hex, and then deals immense damage
spirit_mapinguari.spiritDescription: Wretched are the cursed, for they shall inherint misery. The gods themselves have seen to mine.

spirit_maximon.spriitBehavior: Banishes its summoner's attacker and target
spirit_maximon.spiritDescription: A glass filled with spirits, and a cigar in hand is the proper way to gain my attention.  Tell me your desires for I'm friends with the Saints.

spirit_mishipeshu.spriitBehavior: A powerful warrior that casts Confusion on its enemies
spirit_mishipeshu.spiritDescription: I rule the creatures of water both shallow and deep.  At my command the waves tower, and the wind will thrash the land. I'm unlikely to suffer your presence.

spirit_moonSnake.spriitBehavior: A summoner protector that Blesses allies in need
spirit_moonSnake.spiritDescription: I am the dream bringer, for I am poured from the white breast of the mother moon. I am fond of witches and will serve at your leisure.

spirit_nilith.spriitBehavior: Wicked. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven
spirit_nilith.spiritDescription: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Quisque diam nunc, pulvinar ac ligula sed, finibus accumsan risus. Mauris non mattis ex. Morbi vestibulum, ante at bibendum cursus, purus massa mattis mauris, ac fermentum nisi erat a neque. Integer lectus elit, vehicula eu risus id,

spirit_nokken.spriitBehavior: Protects its summoner when needed, and collects useful Botanicals when not
spirit_nokken.spiritDescription: From beneath the Lilly Pad I wait, watching for your hand, or simply your long hair to touch the surface when you reach for the blooming flower.  I'll likely keep you below for a while.

spirit_oni.spriitBehavior: A basic warrior spirit packed with a lot of energy
spirit_oni.spiritDescription: Reborn with tusk, horn, and the desire to further brutalize mankind after living a truly wicked human life, my pleasure is to punish your existence.

spirit_pisadeira.spriitBehavior: Wicked. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven
spirit_pisadeira.spiritDescription: Resting for the night on a full stomach is my invitation. If you are lucky enough to survive my strangle's grasp, I will surely be back for more.

spirit_quetzalcoatl.spriitBehavior: An effective warrior that Blesses wounded allies and Silences wounded enemies
spirit_quetzalcoatl.spiritDescription: I am the winged serpent and giver of life.  My affection for you is boundless.

spirit_redcap.spriitBehavior: Attacks wounded enemies and allies alike
spirit_redcap.spiritDescription: I dwell in the ruins of tyranny.  With sharpened teeth, ghoulish nails, and by bludgeoning, I murder alongside the dark memories of wicked deeds.  Beware. My cap must soak in the blood that spills from your veins.

spirit_redMan.spriitBehavior: Casts Hex on its enemies, but also its allies
spirit_redMan.spiritDescription: Good luck becomes the norm if you associate with me, but you'll have to be able to withstand a bit o me mirth first.

spirit_ryeWolf.spriitBehavior: Dedicates itself to protecting its summoner
spirit_ryeWolf.spiritDescription: Blood thirsty, ruthless, and relentless once I've your scent.  Loyal to my kind.

spirit_saci.spriitBehavior: Not very useful for combat, but good at distracting opponents
spirit_saci.spiritDescription: You know the days that everything goes wrong? It pleases me to be responsible for each and every bit of it. I dare you to take my red hat.

spirit_sentinelOwl.spriitBehavior: A watchful eye that attacks threatening enemies
spirit_sentinelOwl.spiritDescription: Only the clever will benefit from my silent gaze.

spirit_sidhe.spriitBehavior: Casts Confusion on its attackers and then targets them
spirit_sidhe.spiritDescription: Under the emerald hills of Eire I dwell, but should you locate me viewing the sky, I'll bless you with harp, song, story, and love, for I'm masters of all.

spirit_strigoi.spriitBehavior: Wicked. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven
spirit_strigoi.spiritDescription: I can turn myself into any breathing creature, or dismiss myself from the human eye. I can take what I want with ease, and not a witch can stop me.

spirit_strix.spriitBehavior: Wicked. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven
spirit_strix.spiritDescription: It matters not how far you flee. I smell your blood from leagues away, and will stop at nothing to quench my thirst.

spirit_tanuki.spriitBehavior: Confuses its attackers when present, and collects Tools and Botanicals when not
spirit_tanuki.spiritDescription: I'm built for hijinks of every sort.  It's unwise to cavort with me, but I promise fun if you do.  Simply point me to a source of amusement.

spirit_thunderBird.spiritDescription: You hear the thunder of my wings, and see the lightning that I command. I am often carved in my admirer's totems.

spirit_undine.spriitBehavior: Attacks weakened enemies and Blesses weakened allies
spirit_undine.spiritDescription: Once the attendant of the sea god Poseidon I shift my form from water to flesh with ease.  Secrets I have, and secrets I'll share if you'll join me beneath the shimmering surface.

spirit_vila.spiritDescription: Comely and seductive in my native wilds I whisper and the winds obey. Do not misjudge me, the earth trembles when I bring war.

spirit_wanderingHead.spriitBehavior: Not effective in combat, but alerts its summoner when enemies are present
spirit_wanderingHead.spiritDescription: Standing with my back to you, you cannot see my lunatic grin.  As you near, my body slips into the earth until only my head remains, which I will then turn to you so that I can witness your terror.  Run, if you will, I am quicker than you think.

spirit_wendigo.spriitBehavior: Wicked. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven
spirit_wendigo.spiritDescription: My kingdom is the forests of the high north. Disturb me if you dare; blood and fear and desperation will undoubtedly follow.

spirit_whiteLady.spriitBehavior: Casts Greater Hex on its weakened enemies
spirit_whiteLady.spiritDescription: Mournfully, and but for the occasional wail, I quietly haunt this place. I'm attached to the building, to the grounds, but cannot always tell you why.  Please, do not pursue me. Your life causes me distress.

spirit_xochipilli.spriitBehavior: Blesses weakened allies and Silences weakened enemies
spirit_xochipilli.spiritDescription: I adore your mortality and find happiness in your creative soul.  Join me amongst the flowers to dance, to follow the sun, and in all that is beautiful.

spirit_xolotl.spriitBehavior: Binds weakened enemies, but Leeches the Bound, friend or foe
spirit_xolotl.spiritDescription: Few gods are special enough to be formed with the eyeless head of a dog, and a perfectly deformed body, but I am.  Nor are others permitted to lead the sun through the night realm so that it might rise again come dawn. Might, I say.  You will only find misfortune should our paths cross.

spirit_xtabay.spriitBehavior: Casts Greater Hex on its weakened enemies and attackers
spirit_xtabay.spiritDescription: My song a sweet temptation, come to me beneath the ceiba tree.

spirit_yukiOnna.spriitBehavior: Alerts its summoner of nearby enemies while disguised as a witch
spirit_yukiOnna.spiritDescription: I am winter, irresistable to your eye, hoarfrost upon my breath, and envious of your warmth.  I am your irreversible end.

spirit_zarabanda.spriitBehavior: Wicked. Summoning is forbidden by order of the Grey Hand Coven
spirit_zarabanda.spiritDescription: I am the messanger to the underworld. Through my undying might, one can open their world to the other side.

spirit_greyShade.spiritDescription: I long for the endless rest, but find no sleep. I persist, I remain, I am the disposessed. Dear God grant me peace.

lore_1.description: Chichen Itza is a large ancient city belonging to the Mayans. Here stands the famous El Castillo, an enormous pyramid also known as the Temple of Kukulkan. Snake-like sculpture motifs line the steps of the pyramid. Stay a while to witness the descent of great Mayan god, Kukulcan. Twice a year on the equinoxes a snakelike shadow which is said to be the embodiment of Kukulcan descend the steps of the structure.
lore_1.title: The Serpent Decent
lore_1.value: Travel to Chichen Itza in Yucatan, Mexico.

lore_2.description: Scottish landscaped was said to be forged by the winter witch, Blue Hag. Supposedly the rolling hills were caused by rocks falling from her wicker basket.  She was known by many names and was extremely pivotal in local lore. One legend suggests that she was responsible for controlling the water flow for a well on top a nearby mountain. One night she fell asleep and the water overflowed, drowning anyone in its wake. She woke to the horror of her mishap and turned to stone.
lore_2.title: The Blue Hag's Loch
lore_2.value: Travel to Loch Awe near Dalavich, Scotland.

lore_3.description: The Skirvin Hotel was built in 1910 and is home to an unyielding presence. According to myth, owner, W. B. Skirvin had an affair with one of the maids. He locked her and their child in a small room to prevent any scandal. She was never let out. After going insane in her prison, she took her child and jumped out the window. Guest swear they can still hear the cries of a small child. Men have encountered the maid in their showers and have heard her voice calling out to them. Even after closing and reopening again the ghosts of Skirvin's mistake still haunt the halls.
lore_3.title: Enjoy your Stay
lore_3.value: Travel to Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, United States

lore_4.description: Crater Lake is famous for being not only a beautiful spot for hikers but also holds the title of the deepest lake in the United States. This lake is the result of the massive volcanic eruption of Mount Mazama thousands of years ago. But the myths of the native Klamath tribe tell a different story. They speak of a great battle between Lla-O, god of the underworld, and Skell, god of the sky. The epic tells of a full-length battle lasting several days. To appease the gods, men offered to sacrifice themselves to no avail.
lore_4.title: Doomsday Crater
lore_4.value: Travel to Crater Lake, Oregon, United States

lore_5.description: Once thought to be a complete myth, the Boiling River exists hidden deep in the Amazon. The waters are so hot they instantly kill anything that has the misfortune of submerging in its depths. Locals say the river is sacred and only shamans dare approach it. The waters supposedly have healing powers and are linked to powerful jungle spirits.
lore_5.title: Deadly Waters

lore_6.description: Broken Mountain is the highest peak of the Harz mountain range. Here many of the famous German fairy tales find their origin but it is not just Grimm Brother tales that call this place home.  A history of witches are alive in the mountains. Witches would gather and fly on Walpurgis Night to face evils at the peek. Here the healers gathered their herbs for the year. Locals visited the sacred wells and built bonfires to scare away evil spirits.
lore_6.title: Sending the Witch to Bloksbjerg

lore_7.description: Galicia is of many towns throughout Spain that celebrate Noche de San Juan, or St. John's Eve. Many gather around bonfires to celebrate the traditions Midsummer's Eve. Fire is said to have protected them against evil spirits. The night becomes alive with their light and celebration. People share food, drink, and dances. Water is used for purifications in this ritual. Women gather medical plants, dip them in sacred water, and hang them on doorways. These are common practices found throughout Europe.
lore_7.title: Lite the Bonfire
lore_7.value: Travel to  A Coruna, Galicia, Spain

lore_8.description: Many know the story of King Minos and the Minotaur. This man-eating monster is the result of an affair between the queen and one of Poseidon's sacred bulls. Minos, fearful of this monster locked the beast away in an enormous labyrinth. This elaborate architecture was once thought to be a complete myth as well. However, roughly 20 miles away from Mino's palace a network of constructed tunnels lies just underground. They have been used for many things over the years but were they first used to hold a monster?
lore_8.title: A Forgotten Labrinth
lore_8.value: Travel to Knossos in Crete, Greece

lore_9.description: The name "Bunnyman" doesn't sound like it would be the bringer of fear. However, Fairfax Bridge is known as "The Bunny Man Bridge" because of this terrifying legend. Countless  sightings show a man wearing a white suit, bunny ears, and holding an ax threatening anyone who comes near. In 1904 a bus transporting asylum patients crashed and all but one were found. Douglas Griffon has not been seen since, but the Bunnymen still kills any who wander too close. Dead, skinned rabbits still litter the area and many fear traveling there at midnight on Halloween.
lore_9.title: Beware the Bunnyman
lore_9.value: Travel to Clifton, Virginia, United States

lore_10.description: There is a small body of water known for ghostly wails in the dead of night. This is "Woman Hollering Creek" and it stems from common legend in the world. She has many different names but most famously in the Southeast she is called La Llorona. The story goes that a woman devastated from her husband's affair goes insane and drowns her children. After she realizes what she has done, she drowns herself. Now she is cursed to wander the waterways in search of her lost children. Don't stand too close to water lest she thinks you are one of them.
lore_10.title: Don't get too Close
lore_10.value: Travel to Saint Hedwig, Texas, United States

lore_11.description: Sanzine Eve is a custom celebrated throughout Romania. Sanziana means gentle fairy and these fairies play a big role in the traditions. During the day women dress in white and collect the Galium verum flower. At night they don flower crowns and dance with their loved ones around bonfires. The crowns are thrown at the homes and any that stay on the roof promise a good harvest for that family. This is a night where magic becomes stronger. Do not walk the roads at night for If the fairies see you they will attack
lore_11.title: Night of the Gentle Fairies
lore_11.value: Travel to Piatra Neamt near the Carpathian Mountains, Romania.

lore_12.description: Triora is home to a dark history for witches. Those living in Europe in the 16th century faced an onslaught of trials here. In the devastating times of famine many declare it must have been witchcraft. Innocent women were rounded up and blamed for the misfortune of others. Now a museum of witchcraft honors the fallen and summer festivals are held to celebrate the witches of old.
lore_12.title: Honor the Past

lore_13.description: Take a trip underground to discover treasures excavated. These finds tell the history of Krakow from the past 700 years. Here lies a vampire's dread; The Dragon Lair in Wawel Castle. Polish Folklore suggests that vampires were born from the way they were buried. To prevent those who were suspected of becoming vampires they were buried with their hands tied and their heads cut off. Witches weren't the only ones hunted by man and here you can find the iron shackles left by the vampire's remains.
lore_13.title: A Vampire's Grave

lore_14.description: Sometimes love connects us past out time here on earth. In Bangkok, a temple name Wat Mahabut honors a tragic ghost story of love lost. Mae Nak Phra Khanong was deeply in love with her husband Mak. However, their time together alive was cut short. While Mak was stationed in war, Mae and her unborn child did not survive childbirth. Mak remained unaware of this when he returned as we was greeted by them both in their home. It didn't take long fo him to discover he was now living among their spirits. Once her spirit was finally put to rest, he dedicate this shire to his late family.
lore_14.title: A Ghost Bride's Shrine

lore_15.description: In Greek mythology, Zeus is the king of the gods. This is because of both his tremendous power and without him, the gods would still be trapped in the belly of the titan lord, Kronos. Rhea, longing for the destruction of the mad titan, hid Zeus away. It is thought to be here, in the Dikteon Cave, where Zeus was able to hide and to grow strong enough to defeat Kronos.
lore_15.title: Zeus's Hideaway

lore_16.description: A nearby waterfall shares the name of an infamous terrifying local legend, La Ciguapa. Eyewitnesses say she is beautiful with black eyes and long dark hair. She takes refuge in the wilderness waiting to emerge on the eve of the full moon. The succubus enchants men into following her back to her lair where she devours them. While there are variations in legends of her exact personality each depiction mentions her backward facing feet. A fact that only makes it that much harder to find her.
lore_16.title: Don't Trust the Footprints
lore_16.value: Travel to Pico Duarte, Dominican Republic.

lore_17.description: In the Tuscan forest, an enchanting old tree stands. This old oak sings with the magic of witch lore and has even been the inspiration to the beloved tale, Pinocchio. Witches would gather here, dancing in the branches. Rituals held there embedded the bark with magic, stunting its growth. Their enchantment is said to have caused the tree to become warped and grow out rather than up.
lore_17.title: Witches Gathering
lore_17.value: Travel to Capannori, Province of Lucca, Italy

lore_18.description: A playground stands next to Maple Hill cemetery. It was meant to occupy children while their parent's grieved nextdoor. No one could prepare for its more sinister existence. Legend foretell of the children buried on the grounds that rise to play in the middle of the night. Many have claimed strange events such as orbs of light and swings moving on their own. Some even swear they hear children's laughter in the dead of night.
lore_18.title: The Dead Children's Playground

lore_19.description: By the 16th century, many cemeteries were practically overflowing with bodies. The people in Evora did not want to condemn those buried and created solution. They built the Chapel of Bones. Here, those who had passed were displayed everywhere. The building itself seems almost completely made of bones. This wasn't done out of malice but to remind the people of death. It is a quiet place for meditation.
lore_19.title: Chapel of Bones

lore_20.description: Venture in the nearby Golosov Ravine if you dare. People throughout history have been getting lost in the thick green mist only to reemerge in a different time. The earliest recorded account happened in 1621. Soldiers that were lost in 1571 had found their way out, unaware much time had past. Other cases tell of people getting lost but being redirected by creatures in the mist. They claimed large hairy creatures directed them back on the path to freedom.
lore_20.title: Time Traveler's Path

lore_21.description: The legend of Nale Ba is rather prominent in many rural parts of India. She is a witch that roams the lands in search of her dead husband. Nale Ba will call out in a familiar voice in attempt to trick you into leaving the safety of your home. Villagers have thwarted her in the past by writing her own name on their doors. Be careful not to stray into the streets at night, lest she steal you away.
lore_21.title: Come Tomorrow
lore_21.value: Travel to Anantapur, Andhra Pradesh, India.

lore_22.description: The Mongolian Death Worm calls the Gobi Desert home. This mysterious creature is red in color, two to seven feet long, and can be as thick as a man's arm. The name brings with it the fear of its deadly venom and electric shock. The beasts travels underground and can only be detected through shifts in the sand. Make sure to watch where you step!
lore_22.title: Deadly Desert
lore_22.value: Travel to The Flaming Cliffs in the Gobi Desert, Mongolia.

lore_23.description: El Sombreron, an infamous Guatemalan spirit, seeks to steal young women away. He wears a large sombrero, dresses in all black, and moves from town to town with a pack of mules. He goes in search of beautiful girls with long hair and bright eyes to scenerade with his silver guitar. Those who fall victim to his song are taken back to his lair where he feeds them dirt.
lore_23.title: El Sombreron

lore_24.description: The iconography of a spectral black hound is common in English folklore. The Barghest is one of the most well known representations for the monstrous dog. With intimidating features this spirit is seen as a bad omen, often predicting death.  Luckily for the witches of the world, a barghest will become a loyal companion when summoned.
lore_24.title: The Spectral Hound

lore_25.description: This is final resting place for the tragic loss of Mercy Brown. Her grave is well protected now but in the 1890's this was not the case. The Brown family was losing family members left and right due to an unidentified sickness. After the passing of Mercy, her sister, and mother, her brother soon started to show symptoms. So the townsfolk, fearing a vampire's reach beyond they grave, exhumed the Brown family. Both the sister and mother showed appropriate signs of decomposition. However, Mercy's body seemed almost alive. To save her brother, they cut out her heart, burned it, and fed it to him. It did not work.
lore_25.title: Eat her heart out.

lore_26.description: The famous El Salvador spirit, Sihuanaba, is not someone you want to run into. From a distances she appears to be a beautiful woman with long hair. Take a closer look, and you'll come to face a mare's head on a womens body. This curse was placed on her when she abandoned her son to seek the company of another. Now she roams free seeking to punish unfaithful men. If you see a woman bathing with a golden comb do not go any closer. For if you follow her into that water, you will forfeit your soul.
lore_26.title: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder.
lore_26.value: Travel to La Joya Forest, El Salvador.

lore_27.description: Kuchisake-onna is twisted spirit that has been terrorizing souls since the Edo period. Once beautiful, she was mutilated by her husband and her restless spirit travels from town to town asking if she is beautiful. If a woman wearing a surgical mask walks up to you and asks if you think she's is pretty, do your best to stump her and run away. If you say no, she will kill you. If you say yes, she will removed the mask and repeat the question. Under that mask is a gruesome scar stretching from ear to ear. When she asks again and you say no, she will kill you. If you respond yes, she will give you a scar so you can be beautiful like her.
lore_27.title: Am I pretty?

lore_28.description: The summer solstice awakens magic across the world. Here in Bulgaria they celebrate it as Enyovden. This tradition centers around the prosperity of health and fertility. Upon waking up on Enyovden, it is customary to look for your shadow. If the shadow shows your whole body, then you will be full of life and health throughout the year. All water on Enyovden is said to hold curative powers and you must bathe in running water. Healing Herbs are said to have the most powerful during the morning of Enyovden. If you seek health this is the best place to go.
lore_28.title: Healing Sunrise

lore_29.description: Umdlwenguli Obomvu is a living urban legend. Otherwise known as Pinky Pinky, this strange looking monster hunts down any girl who is alone. She is known to be very active throughout South Africa and brings fear with her name. Pinky Pinky will torment or even murder her victims. If you see a pinked toned humanoid monster coming your way, run.
lore_29.title: Run while you can.
lore_29.value: Travel to Durban, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa.

lore_30.description: Because of its isolation from the rest of Chile, Chiloe is home to a unique selection of spirits and myths. Trickster troll couple El Trauco and La Fiura hunt down humans for sport. El Trauco uses his breath to become irresistible to women and enjoys luring them away. La Fiura wears only moss and seduces men by bathing in pods where she will either kills them or make them lose their minds.  It's probably safer to stay out of the woods.
lore_30.title: Beware the Trolls
lore_30.value: Travel to Chonchi, Chiloe Island, Chile.

lore_31.description: King Lir and his wife, Eva, had four beautiful children whom they loved very much. Unfortunately, their happiness was short lived when Eva did not survive the birth of their twins. Lir decided to remarry for the sake of his children. Aoife was Eva's sister and said to have magic powers. Once again they were a happy family but  Aoife soon grew jealous of Lir's connection with his children. Hoping to get rid of the them, she took them to the lake and cursed them to be swans for 900 years. She returned to Lir and told him of how they all tragically drowned. A grieving Lir traveled there and found the four beautiful swans. They called out to him and told him of Aoife's deception. He spent the rest of his days with the children.
lore_31.title: The Four Swans

lore_32.description: This tranquil spot holds a very sad urban legend. In heavy rain this common hiking trail becomes very dangerous. The story tells of bride who was on the way to wedding when she was lost to rising storm waters. They were never able to recover her body. Some still claim to see her wearing a red cheongsam brushing her hair by the water. Perhaps she is still preparing for a wedding that will never come.
lore_32.title: A Bride's Demise
lore_32.value: Travel to Bride's Pool, Hong Kong, China.

lore_33.description: You do not want to venture into the waters of Lake Lacar. In its depths, a monster is in constant pursuit its human prey. El Cuero is a dangerous monster to face. Its leather like body is often compared to a dried cow hide and has eyes at the end of long stalks. Razor sharp claws line its body that can latch on to their victims. They are known to attack similarly to crocodiles and will jump out at a moment's notice. Many are warned against traversing any  waterways in fear of El Cuero and its close cousin, Hueke-Hueke.
lore_33.title: Lurking Beneath
lore_33.value: Travel to Lake Lacar, Andes Mountains, Argentina.

lore_34.description: Skinwalkers are becoming more aggressive in the southwest United States. Try not to think about them and if you call out their name it's already too late. They come from Navajo legend of medicine men corrupted into monsters. Skinwalkers wear the pelts of different animals that they then can use to shapeshift.  They can match the speed of cars and tear into their prey ferociously. Like most evil spirits, they travel at night, so you are safer indoors.
lore_34.title: Skinwalkers

lore_35.description: A strange monkey-man started terrorizing citizens of Delhi back in 2001. There are some varying accounts as to what is his exact appearance but this may be because he only attacks at night. Many say he is about four feet tall, covered in fur, with large metal claws. Victims have reported being scratched and there are several cases of death. This monkey-man has led to extreme panic and very little is known about him.
lore_35.title: Kala Bandar

lore_36.description: Once a year, the world here comes alive with gold. A stretching landscape of bright foliage draws the eye for miles. This magical occasion occurs for a week before the trees return to their dark reds and browns of the natural habitat. The remote location makes it a hidden spectacle to be sure. Seize your chance to experience this explosion of gold.
lore_36.title: Blooming Bright

lore_37.description: Aka Manto is a Japanese legend about a spirit who haunts the last stall of the bathroom. He will ask from a disembodied voice, "Red paper or blue?" If you answer red, he will attack, turning your clothes red with your blood. If blue is your answer, he will strangle you until you turn blue. The best chance of survival is to avoid public restrooms when you are alone at night.
lore_37.title: Red or Blue?

lore_38.description: Superstitions can often make people feel safe. It's what they do to prevent misfortune and theaters have plenty of superstitious rituals to insure the show goes on. In the Princess Theater, one of these acts include always leaving a seat open for Frederick Baker. In 1888, Baker had a heart attack at the end of his performance and many did not even realize he was dead until after the show. Members of the cast and crew swear they have seen his ghost watching their performances.
lore_38.title: A Ghosty Guest of Honor.

lore_39.description: Los Llanos, a shared grassland of Venezuela and Columbia, is home to the creature El Silbón. There are several versions of his origin but they always start with the boy killing his father. Some say the young boy killed the old man because he hurt his wife. Others claim that El Silbón was a spoiled boy that killed his father for not fulfilling a request and tricked his mother into cooking him into a meal. Both version end with his mother cursing him, grandfather beating him, and  dogs chasing him for all of eternity. Few that have met him survive but those who have describe him as taller than the trees, extremely thin, and carrying a bag full of his victims. If you hear a whistle you know he is near. The sound can be deceiving though, because the closer the sound is, the farther away is his.
lore_39.title: Listen for a Whistle

lore_40.description: Standing in the middle of a peaceful field, the naturally formed Druid Stone feels almost out of place. This altar is shaped like a gate that would often serve a great purpose in rituals. The light on the May Day sunrise lines up with this stone giving it great celestial power. Lore suggests that the doorway created was a symbol for rebirth and has ties with health and fertility. Those past through it were reborn healthier.
lore_40.title: A Gate Between

lore_41.description: A necropolis is a city made for the dead. Often people are buried with their belongings to help them carry over into the next life. Here in Dargavs, a little village stands, holding the dead within. It all seems quite charming and quaint until you realize what is inside. In front of each crypt there is a well to tell the living if the dead went to heaven or hell. Drop a coin and if it hits stone at the bottom it's a good sign. Some say that this was a place for people to wait for death as they fought sickness.
lore_41.title: The City of the Dead

lore_42.description: Looking out on Qiandao Lake, you may never know what lies beneath the calm waters. But for those who know what they are looking for, might be able to see the city of Shi Cheng below the surface. This ancient city has been miraculously preserved. Much of it still stands to tell us about the civilization of the Eastern Han Dynasty. This underwater metropolis is the result of a damn flooding to make Qiandao lake. Many speculate, however, it more preserved that it would have been left exposed to the harsh winds and sun.
lore_42.title: Dive for Treasure
lore_42.value: Travel to Xin'anjiang Reservoir, Hangzhou, China.

lore_43.description: In modern horror, dolls are often used as the manifestation of evil. While the Island of Dolls is a sad story, it is not one full of malice. About fifty years ago, Don Julian Santana left his family to live alone on an island. In isolation, Santana claims to have witness the drowning of a little girl. Saddened by this loss, he began collecting dolls. They slowly started to take up the island and his home. Santana saw them as protectors but sadly he soon drowned where he saw the little girl several years prior.
lore_43.title: Doll Island

lore_44.description: Salem is home to the infamous Salem Witch Trials and has a lot of history for witchkind. The Trials were held back in 1692 and killed too many innocent witches. Now only one house remains with direct ties to the them. This last house belonged to the judge Jonathan Corwin who was responsible for the death of 19 women. Today the house serves as a museum and reminder of the travesty.
lore_44.title: The Last Home

lore_45.description: Gashadokuro are giant bloodthirsty skeletons made from the bones of soldiers lost to famine and war that were left unburied. The hungry ghosts rise to form this 90 foot beast. The creature was created by a war chief's daughter as a last resort to save their tribe. Gashadokuro are invisible until the moment they strike. If you hear a ringing in your ears, be on alert, the monster is near. Escape is the only way to survive.
lore_45.title: Starving Skeleton

LoadingTips.value: Wild spirits are located around the world in their native environment.
Defeating wild spirits will give you the knowledge required to summon them.
You can summon more than one spirit at the time.
Summoning spirits while controlling a Place of Power is instant and costs no energy.
Spirits summoned within a Place of Power stay and defend the PoP from attack.
The Spirit Deck will display all the spirits that a witch has learned to summon.
Summoning a spirit requires you to possess the right tool.
Defeated spirits will often drop tools required to summon them.
Beware. Some spirits are not happy to be summoned.
Hunting wild spirits is a good way to earn silver.
Savannah Grey blesses witches each day by restoring their base energy level.
Base energy for a witch starts at 1000 and increases by 100 with each level gained.
Your energy cap is the maximum amount of energy that you may possess. This grows along with your level.
Use Elixirs of Energy wisely. If you are already near your max energy cap, consuming in excess may not be beneficial.
Zero energy causes a death state.
While in death state most actions are restricted.
A witch's energy must rise above zero to exit the death state.
To defeat an opponent, use spells and drop their energy to zero.
Elixirs of Energy can be purchased with silver from Madam Fortuna.
Elixirs of Invisibility and True Sight can be purchased with silver from Madam Fortuna.
Elixirs of Alignement and Experience can be purchased with silver from Madam Fortuna.
A witch consumes elixirs from the Alchemy Page in their Book of Shadows.
The Elixir of Invisibility stops working once a witch does witchy things.
The Elixir of Invisibility continues working while a witch is in flight.
True Sight elixir allow you to see through invisibility.
The Elixir of Alignment increases the effect your spells have on your alignment.
Elixir of Experience increases the experience gained from all sources.
If you're running low on silver visit Madam Fortuna's shop to buy more.
Visit Madame Fortuna to shop for your wardrobe.
Madame Fortuna has many curious goods to trade with witches.
Silver Drachs are the main currency in the world of Covens.
Gold Drachs are very rare and can only be earned from certain Places of Power and Daily Achievements.
The Book of Shadow records the signature spells that a witch has discovered.
Ingredients can be added to spells for greater results.
Adding the right combination of ingredients to a spell unlocks powerful Signature spells.
Adding the wrong combination of ingredients to a spell may cause unwelcome results.
Signature spells are crafted when correct ingredients are blended to base spells.
Spells are divided into three schools of magic: Light, Gray and Shadow. The spell you choose aligns a witch to those schools.
All members of a coven gain the benefits of a Place of Power controlled by their coven.
A coven can have up to 13 members before it must to convert to a hive.  A hive may consist of hundreds of witches.
A witch does not need to join a coven, but the power of a well maintained coven is desirable to most.
A witch can send a request to other witches to join a coven or hive.
A witch can only belong to one coven at a time.
Use World or Dominion chat to talk with a witch outside of your coven.
Witches are more powerful when their coven mates are near. This power increases with every nearby coven mate.
The event log describes important things that happen while you're witching.
A witch can choose to complete daily objectives and receive rewards for their effort.
Madame Fortuna sells bundles of various ingredients used in witchcraft.
A witch can assume spirit form and fly anywhere in the world, but the further from their physical body, the weaker they become.
Some Places of Power can only be entered while in physical form.
Casting on another witch will alert them of the attack.
After hunting the globe in spirit form, use the recall button to return to your physical location.
Phases of the moon influence a witch's energy and power based on their alignment.
To prepare for the Ember Days, witches compete in seasonal tournaments of witchcraft that are tied to Spring, Summer, Autumn and Winter.
A witch can change the color of their magic by using the Hand of Heka.
Change the look of your map by visiting the settings screen.
Push notifications from Covens can be turned on or off in the settings screen.
Visit the Witch School located within the settings screen to accelerate your education.

sh.value: Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha

gs.value: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
